historical_sites.name: Tombs of the Kings
historical_sites.description: An impressive necropolis dating back to the 4th century BC, it is a UNESCO World Heritage site.

historical_sites.name: Paphos Archaeological Park
historical_sites.description: Famous for its ancient Roman mosaics, this archaeological park is one of the city's top attractions.

historical_sites.name: House of Dionysus
historical_sites.description: A luxurious Roman villa, famous for its intricate mosaics depicting scenes from Greek mythology.

historical_sites.name: Sanctuary of Aphrodite
historical_sites.description: Located in Kouklia, this is one of the most important ancient Greek sanctuaries dedicated to the goddess Aphrodite.

historical_sites.name: Paphos Castle
historical_sites.description: A medieval castle located at the edge of Paphos harbour, it was originally built to protect the city.

popular_spots.name: Paphos Harbour
popular_spots.description: A picturesque area lined with restaurants, cafes, and shops. A perfect place for a walk.

popular_spots.name: Aphrodite's Rock
popular_spots.description: According to legend, this is the birthplace of Aphrodite, the goddess of love and beauty.

popular_spots.name: Coral Bay
popular_spots.description: A popular sandy beach located just north of Paphos, perfect for swimming and relaxing.

popular_spots.name: Paphos Old Town
popular_spots.description: Known for its charming streets, traditional markets, and cultural landmarks.

popular_spots.name: Akamas Peninsula National Park
popular_spots.description: A natural paradise offering stunning landscapes, hiking trails, and wildlife, located near Paphos.

cultural_events.name: Paphos Cultural Festival
cultural_events.description: Held annually, this festival celebrates the rich cultural heritage of Paphos with performances, exhibitions, and events.

cultural_events.name: Aphrodite Festival
cultural_events.description: A famous international opera festival held at the medieval castle of Paphos.

cultural_events.name: Paphos Beer Festival
cultural_events.description: An annual celebration where locals and tourists can enjoy a wide variety of beers along with music and food.

natural_wonders.name: Adonis Baths Waterfalls
natural_wonders.description: A beautiful waterfall where, according to Greek mythology, Adonis and Aphrodite spent time together.

natural_wonders.name: Blue Lagoon
natural_wonders.description: A stunning lagoon with crystal-clear waters, perfect for swimming and snorkeling, located in the Akamas Peninsula.

museums.name: Paphos District Archaeological Museum
museums.description: Features archaeological finds from the Paphos region dating from the Neolithic to the Middle Ages.

museums.name: Byzantine Museum of Paphos
museums.description: Houses a rich collection of Byzantine icons and ecclesiastical artifacts from the 7th to the 18th century.

transportation.bus_service: Paphos has a regular bus service that connects the city to other parts of Cyprus, including Limassol and Nicosia.
transportation.taxi: Taxis are widely available throughout Paphos.

food_specialties.name: Souvlaki
food_specialties.description: A popular Cypriot dish consisting of grilled meat, typically served with salad and pita bread.

food_specialties.name: Halloumi
food_specialties.description: A traditional Cypriot cheese made from a mixture of goat and sheep milk, often grilled or fried.

food_specialties.name: Loukoumades
food_specialties.description: Small fried dough balls soaked in honey or syrup, commonly found in local festivals.

fun_facts: Paphos is believed to be the birthplace of Aphrodite, the Greek goddess of love and beauty.
In 2017, Paphos was one of the European Capitals of Culture.
